website_summaries.verdict: The top choice for consumer-grade pitching machines right now. It is an investment, but it's worth the price if you are serious about batting practice.
pros: Consistent timed delivery allows for rhythm in practice
cons: On the more expensive end of the spectrum, but you are paying for construction quality and durability

customer_reviews.title: Better for softball
customer_reviews.text: Fastballs rise, which is unrealistic for baseball. I think it works great for softball, because of the rise and the closer distance you use this machine from. Balls also tend to slow a little mid flight. I recommend using indoor to avoid wind.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent B.

customer_reviews.title: There are so many uses for this machine. Find ...
customer_reviews.text: There are so many uses for this machine. Find some HARD softies and it will pitch faster and straighter. Hard one's are difficult to find. the Juggs machine softies are a little too soft. I have used for Tee Ballers throwing softballs slow, I have used as a curve ball and slider pitching for 14u girls, and I have used as a fly ball machine (from a limited distance). Since its portable, we use it at various locations. So far I give this baby a 10!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy H. Holt

customer_reviews.title: So glad we got this!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this along with a netting alley for our girls to have extra batting practice at home. I wish we would have done it years ago (literally!). In the few months we have had this our girls confidence and ability to hit different pitches coming at them has improved... and coach noticed after only having it for a week! We were a bit worried about the lighter balls but have found that it is really not an issue. The price seems high but if you use it as much as we do it is well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Lisat

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical with the lite balls but this thing is amazing! It’s easy to carry and assemble. I also ran it off a portable battery. I wish I could get it a bit faster but if you just get closer you get the same effect. I got nailed with a line drive to the arm and I was totally fine! My 14 year old daughter was even more skeptical then me at first but once she felt a good connection she loved it too. I highly recommend for any age.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: overall a good product , consistent and accurate for a machine . the thing is build to last ! easy to adjust and use for any age really, a kid can run this thing. Machine will only help their swing so much! the problem with using pitching machines is timing . kids need to be able to work on timing a pitcher up and a machine doesn't allow this. my kid actually got worse using this , it has it's place and it's fun for them, but if you are thinking this will solve their batting issues it won't . there is a reason professionals don't use pitching machines.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Lite-flite pitching machine review
customer_reviews.text: I really like the machine so far, you just need to understand its limitations. I read that it pitched a softball 30-50 mph. I can only get the 11 lite-flite ball go 34mph. It's great set up between 20-25ft away. We will only use it for hitting. Doesnt throw grounders well or go very far to the outfield.

product_meta.title: JUGS Lite-Flite Machine for Baseball and Softball
product_meta.description:
The JUGS Lite-FLite Machine throws Lite-Flite and poly baseballs and softballs with a full-range of movement that includes fastballs, curves and sliders. The swivel-design base casting also provides 360-degree versatility for fly balls, ground balls and pop-ups. This product uses only the Lite-Flite baseballs/softballs or Bulldog polyballs by JUGS, the use of other balls may result in damage to machine.

Pitch for pitch and dollar for dollar, the JUGS Lite-Flite Machine is a terrific choice for up-and-coming hitters who want to hone their swings. Designed to throw only Lite-Flite baseballs, 11- or 12-inch Lite-Flite softballs or JUGS Bulldog baseballs and softballs, young hitters can learn how to hit sharp-breaking pitches without the fear of being hit. The machine offers a full range of movement that adjusts for all types of pitches, including fastballs, curveballs, and sliders. In addition, you can adjust the swivel-design base casting 360 degrees to simulate fly balls, ground balls, and pop-ups—a must for fielders who want to practice defense in the backyard. And it doesn't matter which side of the plate you prefer, the Lite-Flite Machine throws both left- and right-handed pitches.

Other features include the JUGS "always see the ball" delivery system, a quick-change design with exclusive Switch-and-Play knobs for adjusting the machine from baseball to softball in seconds, and a portable design with an 1/8-horsepower, 1.3 amp motor. Designed to work both indoors and outdoors, the Lite-Flite Machine weighs only 35 pounds and carries a two-year warranty.

Note: The Lite-Flite Machine is compatible with the JUGS Rechargeable Battery Pack (sold separately), a self-contained battery that runs your Lite-Flite Machine for up to 3 hours of continuous use. Designed to recharge in only four hours, the battery pack comes complete with a 32-inch extension cord, a battery recharger, a nylon shoulder strap, and a heavy-duty nylon carrying case.

Specifications:

 * Recommended age: 8 to adult
 * Speed range: 30 to 50 miles per hour
 * Speed adjustments: Dial
 * Rechargeable battery pack: Sold separately
 * Power source: 110-volt AC
 * Motor: 1/8-horsepower, 1.3 amp
 * 360-degree swivel: Yes
 * Automatic feeder: Sold separately
 * In-line switch: Sold separately
 * Weight: 35 pounds
 * Warranty: 2 year
